name: Smokin' Good Cowboy Burgers
description: Meal prep the easy way and make a big batch of burgers so you can plan for dinner tonight and tuck some in the freezer for another day. Winner-winner, burger dinner!

ingredients.name: Pulled Pork Seasoning or  Smokin' BBQ Sauce Mix
burger buns, split and toasted
ingredients.additionalInstruction: Tip: only use buns for what you’re eating tonight

preparation: In a large bowl, combine ground beef and seasoning; using a fork or your hands, gently mix to combine.
Divide mixture into 12 patties and form each into a ball. Flatten to form patties.
Grill, with lid closed, 4–5 min or until cooked through. Tuck burgers into buns and serve with toppings, as desired.
tips: Individually wrap uncooked patties, and then portion into family-sized packs. Snugly wrap, then place in freezer. Freeze up to 2 months. Defrost before cooking.

products.name: Pulled Pork Seasoning (Pack of 3)
summary: This seasoning is a shortcut to the south when you’re in the mood for some BBQ! Grab a slow cooker and let the pork slowly infuse with notes of deep, sweet ‘n tangy barbecue and a hint of smokiness. So good!
